page.title: 14LANGUAGE
page.content: DIALECT: Surrey settled by Saxons and South Saxon has influenced place names. Today most local people are in-comers and have been moving in since the middle of the 19th Century so that little dialect remains traceable. However, place names still reveal origins as follows: Pitch Hill = Short Steep slope Coneyhurst = Rabbit wood (rabbits brought in by the Normans.) Ewhurst = Yew Wood Hurtwood = Hurts are billberries Farley = bracken clearing Barn Platt = small plot with barn Dewdney's well = owned by John Dewdney Kill Copse = Kiln Copse Stroude Common = strode or a marsh Willinghurst = Willa's stubble land
